column4: some modems are sort of like routers and have similar functionality ( mine does )
for instance I can port-forward and it does nat etc
I've never seen that before, who is your service provider?
optusnet ( Australian)
How old is your modem, and is that a Web interface or a CLI (Telnet, ssh?)
recent - Siemens 4200 , and it has a web interface at 10.1.1.1
have you built a kernel?
no, I just use the images so far - I haven't needed to compile a kernel yet
I compile other stuff though - fluxbox for example, and modules for my iBook to use mac-on-linux etc
I don't understand what you mean by the kernel repository...
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/KernelGitGuide under the Getting the rep section
ah, you're using vanilla kernels from the git pool ? I don't know about that ( I know of it but I haven't tried it)
as far as apt-get is concerned, is the repository the storage location of the debian packages for a certain release, etc (i forget what the restricted / universe thing is called)
repositories are collections of .deb packages, yes
maybe it's the collection of the kernel... source files maybe?
as I understand it, "git" is Linus's access tool for kernel source code
originally there were some other kernel building tools config, menuconfig, and xconfig
git is ubuntu's solution
http://www.linux.org/lessons/interm/c2496.html
no, "git" was written by Linus Torvalds
http://news.com.com/Torvalds+unveils+new+Linux+control+system/2100-7344_3-5678651.html
